intro: Monnina pilgeri, commonly known as the silky bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheats. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Monnina pilgeri is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
